title: Set up workplaces
content_markdown:
Version: 8.0
On this page
Level: beginner
The sets of sections displayed on the Creatio navigation panel for different user groups (roles) are called workplaces. You can set up any workplace by creating a list of sections that are necessary for the users in their everyday work. The sections that are not included in it will be hidden from the main Creatio menu.
The list of available workplaces can vary depending on the user group. For example, a **Communications** workplace can include **Activities** , **Calls** and **Feed** sections available for all system users, and a **Supervisor** workplace can include administration sections for users and roles that are available for the system administrators group only.
Access to the workplaces does not affect the access to Creatio objects.
The full set of Creatio sections the user can access in every workplace is aggregated in the **All apps** workplace. If you have both Classic UI and Freedom UI sections for a specific object, the **All apps** workplace displays only the Freeedom UI section. Manage permissions to view this workplace in the "Can view all apps workplace" ("CanViewAllAppsWorkplace" code) system operation. Creatio does not display the **All apps** workplace if the user has access to only a single workplace.
To access the **workplace setup** :
1. **Open** the System Designer, e.g., by clicking ![btn_system_designer.png](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/btn_system_designer.png).
2. Go to **Set up view** → **Workplace setup** This opens a page.
Fig. 1 Workplace list
![Fig. 1 Workplace list](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/scr_workplace_list.png)
You can take the following steps on the page that opens:
* Set up the list of available workplaces Read more >>>.
* Add workplaces. Read more >>>.
* Edit existing workplaces. Read more >>>.
* Set up sections in the workplace. Read more >>>.
* Provide access permissions to the workplace for different functional and organizational user roles. Read more >>>.
## Set up the list of available workplaces​
To set up a sequence of workplaces:
1. **Select** the required record.
2. **Click** ![btn_up.png](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/btn_up.png) or ![btn_down.png](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/btn_down.png) to move the record up or down (Fig. 2).
Fig. 2 Change the workplace position in the list
![Fig. 2 Change the workplace position in the list](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/scr_change_workplace_order.png)
As a result, Creatio will apply the new workplace order for the workplace menu in the navigation panel. **All apps** workplace will always be displayed first.
## Add a workplace​
To **add a new workplace** :
1. **Click** **New user workplace** and select the workplace type (Fig. 3):
* **General** if you want to set up the list of sections for general internal users.
* **Portal** if you want to set up the list of sections for external users.
Fig. 3 Add a workplace
![Fig. 3 Add a workplace](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/scr_add_a_workplace_8_0.png)
2. **Specify** the workplace name in the **Name** field.
3. **Select** a Freedom UI page to serve as the workplace homepage or click ![btn_add.png](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/btn_add.png) to create a homepage from scratch in the **Home page** field. Available only for workplaces of the **General** type. Learn more: [Set up a homepage](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=2352).
4. **Select** the **Use only in shell** checkbox to display the workplace in Freedom UI. If the checkbox is cleared, Creatio displays the workplace both in Freedom UI and Classic UI.
5. **Save the changes**.
## Edit a workplace​
To edit an existing workplace, select a workplace in the workplace list → **Open** (Fig. 4).
Fig. 4 Edit a workplace
![Fig. 4 Edit a workplace](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/scr_edit_a_workplace.png)
This opens the workplace setup page (Fig. 5).
Fig. 5 Workplace setup page
![Fig. 5 Workplace setup page](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/scr_workplace_setup_page.png)
You can edit the workplace parameters by following steps 2-4 in the previous section.
## Set up sections in the workplace​
You can set up a list of sections for the workplace using the toolbar on the **Sections** detail. To do that:
1. **Click** the ![btn_add.png](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/btn_add.png) button on the detail toolbar. This opens a window (Fig. 6).
Fig. 6 Adding sections to a workplace
![Fig. 6 Adding sections to a workplace](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/scr_select_workplace_sections.png)
2. **Select** the required sections → **Select**.
3. **Save the changes**.
note
If you have a Freedom UI and Classic UI section of the same name, Creatio displays both of them in the selection window.
You can only select from sections available for external users in the **Portal** workplace type.
To **remove a section from a workplace** :
1. **Select** the required record in the block.
2. **Click** ![btn_marketing_plans_detail_menu.png](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/default/files/documents/docs_en/product/bpm'online%20administration/administration/7.16.0/BPMonlineHelp/chapter_workplace_setup/btn_marketing_plans_detail_menu.png) → **Delete**.
3. **Save the changes**.
The sequence of the records in the **Sections** detail is the sequence in which the sections will be displayed in the Creatio navigation panel. To **move the required detail record up or down** :
1. **Select** the record.
2. **Click** the ![btn_up.png](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/btn_up.png) or ![btn_down.png](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/btn_down.png) buttons.
3. **Save the changes**.
note
Configure sections in the No-Code Designer. Learn more: [Manage app elements in the No-Code Designer](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=2418).
Creatio always displays sections in the **All apps** workplace in alphabetical order.
## Set up user roles that need to access the workplace​
View organizational and functional user roles that can access the workplace on the **User groups** detail.
To **set up access to the workplace** :
1. **Go to** the **User groups** detail toolbar and **click the![btn_add.png](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/btn_add.png) button**. This opens a window (Fig. 7).
Fig. 7 Set up access to the workplace for user groups
![Fig. 7 Set up access to the workplace for user groups](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCode_Customization/set_up_workplaces/scr_select_workplace_user_roles.png)
note
You can configure a list of functional and organizational roles, as well as a list of users, in the "Users and administration" block of the System Designer. Learn more: [Users and permissions](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/8.x/setup-and-administration/category/user-and-access-management).
2. **Select** the roles you need → **Select** button. Selected roles will be added to the **User groups** detail of the workplace.
3. **Save the changes**.
As a result, all users of the selected roles will have access to the workplace.
note
The changes will be applied after the user logs in the next time.
* * *
## See also​
[Add corporate logo](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1249)
[Customize colors](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?id=1250)
